Legal_Issue: Whether the Board's decision to deny refugee status was reasonable based on lack of involvement in the campaign and passage of time
Application_Facts: Applicant left Colombia before the FARC campaign began
Lived in the U.S. for 10 years without seeking asylum
No evidence of FARC activity in Bogota
No threats against remaining family members
Decision_Outcome: Board's decision to deny refugee status upheld
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of Refugee Protection Division's decision
Claimant_Status: Individual who lived in the U.S. without legal status
Credibility_Assessment: No evidence supporting ongoing risk or personal targeting
Evidence_Used: Lack of evidence of FARC presence in Bogota
Duration of stay in U.S. without seeking protection
Status of family members in Colombia
Application_Basis: Claim of past threats by FARC against family
Governing_Rule: Standard of review is reasonableness; focus on well-founded fear of persecution
Evidentiary_Deficiency: No demonstration of personal targeting by FARC
Harm_Assessment: No established likelihood of persecution upon return
Cause_Description: Applicant claimed refugee status after living in the U.S. without status, citing past FARC threats against his family
Evidence_Handling: Board considered absence of corroborating evidence regarding current risk
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient evidence to establish personal risk or nexus to protected grounds
Residency_Compliance: Lived in the U.S. for 10 years without legal status or asylum application
Evidence_Assessment: Board found no objective basis for fear of persecution
Decision_Rationale: Decision reasonable despite minor errors due to lack of credible evidence of risk
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of evidence linking applicant to ongoing FARC activities
Failure to explain delay in claiming asylum
